Contradict fact: The claim contradicts the fact that the video shows Indian and Pakistani soldiers dancing together in Pakistan in October 2019. However, the video is actually from military drills in Russia in August 2018.
Lack enough support: The claim lacks enough support as it is based on a misleading video that has been circulating online since at least 2018.
Exist alternative explanation: The alternative explanation is that the video shows Indian and Pakistani soldiers dancing together during military drills in Russia, rather than celebrating the arrival of Sikh religious pilgrims in Pakistan.
Falters at times: The claim falters at times as it misrepresents the context and origin of the video.
Problematic assumption: The claim makes the problematic assumption that the video depicts Indian and Pakistani soldiers dancing together to celebrate the arrival of Sikh religious pilgrims in Pakistan, when it is actually from military drills in Russia.
Exaggerate: The claim exaggerates the significance and context of the video by falsely attributing it to a specific event in Pakistan.
Understate: There is no evidence of understating bias in this claim.
